channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ZOOKEEPER-756] some cleanup and improvements for zooinspector
item.description:
Copied from the already closed ZOOKEEPER-678:

  • specify the exact URL, where the icons are from. It's best to include the link also in the NOTICE.txt file.

It seems, that zooinspector finds it's icons only if the icons folder is in the current path. But when I install zooinspector as part of the Zookeeper Debian package, I want to be able to call it regardless of the current path.
Could you use getRessources or something so that I can point to the icons location from the wrapper shell script?

Can I place the zooinspector config files in /etc/zookeeper/zooinspector/ ? Could I give zooinspector a property to point to the config file location?

There are several places, where viewers is missspelled as "Veiwers". Please do a case insensitive search for "veiw" to correct these. Even the config file "defaultNodeVeiwers.cfg" is missspelled like this. This has the potential to confuse the hell out of people when debugging something!
item.summary: some cleanup and improvements for zooinspector

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I am having so technology issues and am without a development PC at the moment. I won't be able to look at this task for at least a couple of weeks while I sort out a new Development PC. If this issue is urgent i suggest it is assigned to someone else. If not i will endeavour to fix it when i have a new system up and running
pathc file with requested changes
I have attached a patch file to this issue which contains the requested changes. You now need to pass in two program arguments: the location of the config folder and the location of the icons folder.

The patch is failing to apply, please update against the latest source base and resubmit, thanks!

@colin,

Any updates on the patch? As patrick mentioned above, the patch doesnt apply to the trunk.

I have recreated the patch file. I have done this a few times now and I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong so I've explained what I'm doing with TortoiseSVN below, if any of this is wrong could you let me know so that I can recreate it correctly:

  1. Navigated to the repository folder in Windows Explorer
  2. Right-clicked the repository folder and selected TortoiseSVN --> Create Patch...
  3. Selected the files I have changed in the dialog and clicked OK
  4. selected a location and name for the patch file and clicked Save.

The repository is set to check out from the following URL:
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk
Patch submitted - see previous comment

This message is automatically generated.

Looks like line endings are the problem. The current source in svn has some lines with ^M line endings and this seems to be messing up the patch application (at least under unix).

I tried it myself and had similar problems (I'm on unix). I then used dos2unix to convert all the zooinspector files to unix line endings, then reapplied Colin's patch and it patched fine.

I created a new patch file based on this, which I'm now attaching.

Please review this updated patch and make sure I didn't miss anything

This message is automatically generated.
Colin, looks like you are having some weird line ending problem... patch is not applying.
Moving this out to 3.5.

I'm working on a patch from scratch for this. I could not apply the patch from Colin too. The patch also changes the intending so that it'd be way too much work to try "applying" it manually.

I'd like to include the source code of the toaster jar. It's just one class licensed under ASL2. The Licensing FAQ ( http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html ) sounds like it's ok to include source code from other authors:

"Works under the following licenses may be included within Apache products: Apache License 2.0 [...]"

Or should I rather ask legal-discuss?

Thomas - re licensing: including source that's licensed under asl2 is fine (category a), see this: http://www.apache.org/legal/3party.html

(although typically we'd like to pull dependencies in via ivy/maven, but I'm assuming here it's not published in a typical repo?)

This patch reworks the icon handling and replaces the eclipse icons with icons from the Tango project from freedesktop.org. (Tango icons are Public Domain) This was easier then trying to figure out the source of the eclipse icons. This also makes ZooInspector a bit more compliant to freedesktop standards and easier to package.

The JToaster jar has been replaced with its source code. - It was just one java file. JToaster is abandoned, not available in maven and really trivial code that should be replaced.

I added a TODO file to suggest further improvements to ZooInspector. ZooInspector would be a nice project for a student.
sorry, forgot to add something.

I tested ant tar on my machine and it works. The patch file processed by jenkins does not contain binary files. Since I added icons, these won't end up in the tested workspace and the ant tar target fails since it does not find the folder with the icons.

The attached icons.tar.gz must be commited below src/contrib/zooinspector/src. So that we get
src/contrib/zooinspector/src/main/resources/icons/Tango/...

For us to include Toaster.java it needs to have a license header that states it's compatible with our licensing restrictions (ie cat A):
http://www.apache.org/legal/3party.html

also see "treatment of third party works" here:
http://www.apache.org/legal/src-headers.html

Added the following Header to the Toaster.java file:

This java file is copyright by Daniele Piras ("danielepiras80", no email known) released under the
Apache Software License 2.0. It has been downloaded in december 2009 from the CVS web interface
of the sourceforge project http://sourceforge.net/projects/jtoaster/ . The web interface to CVS
is not available anymore on sourceforge.

Note: I removed the legacy icons in addition to adding the new tango based icons.
